data.what_is: Customer.io is a leading customer engagement platform designed for tech-savvy organizations to create personalized customer journeys that engage, convert, and scale. Use first-party data to send meaningful messages across all channels, including email, in-app, push, SMS, and webhooks. Today, 7500+ brands trust their messaging needs with Customer.io, and G2 recently recognized us as a Best Software award winner in the Marketing and Digital Advertising Products category. Customer.io's suite of products includes Journeys, a messaging automation tool, Data Pipelines, a customer data platform; and Parcel, a code editor designed for email. Founded in 2012, Customer.io is a globally distributed, remote-first company named one of the fastest-growing private companies on the 2023 Inc. 5000 list.
data.product_description: A platform for sending targeted messages.Customer.io is the leading marketing automation platform for mid-market companies looking for an enterprise-ready customer engagement solution. Integrate your customer data efficiently through our API, sync with your data warehouse, or CSVs. Audience segments are calculated in real-time and performance scales with your business. The rules-based visual workflow builder allows you to create high-performance campaigns in an intuitive drag-and-drop interface. Reach your customer whenever and wherever they are, in their preferred language. Review real-time conversions and the amount of revenue they drive. Customer.io will send the same segment audience to any ad network with just one click - ensuring your ads are targeted with the most up-to-date information. Choose from drag and drop, HTML, or Rich Text editors. Pick from starter templates or import your own, and then craft your message. When you finish, desktop and mobile previews are created with live data.

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Based on 119 Customer.io reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Based on 117 Customer.io reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: Based on 96 Customer.io reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Workflow Capability

Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

initial_reviews.review_title: The best all-in-one email marketing solution I've ever used.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Strongest features in my opinion: Segments and attribute system, visual workflows in campaings, API and callback support, tools for sms and push notifications.

It's easy to start if you are new to email-marketing tools, 30m onboarding is enough to start senidng.

The visual workflow system for campaigns is superior. There was only one time in 8 month of usage where the needed feature was absent, and it was implemented anyway with a workaround.

Customer support is PHENOMENAL! They reply in seconds! There wasn't even one question that I haven't recieved a answer. When there is no feature to resolve your needs on time, they recommend you a work-around and add your vote to a future feature-request.

Avaliable API and integration option list is huge. Customer.io has everything we use.

As the title says, this is really the best service in the industry. I use it every day and happy our team choosed it.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I don't really liked the new UI colors at first, but I got used to it :)

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our marketing workflows are drastically progressing with a visual workflows feature. We do not waste time and resoureses anymore to export users, we just use the atrributes and Segments feature. Email creation is much easier with WYSIWYG editor, Snippets andd Assets, although HTML wrting is also convenient with two avaliiable editors.

initial_reviews.review_title: Email Marketing Made Easy
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
It helps to make emails more personalized and allows the ability to segment users based on detailed behavior and attributes. The reporting analytics are also good because I am able to see the various activities that were carried out in the email."

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The platform was difficult to learn. It took me a while to understand how to use it. There are too many features, but it's not very user-friendly.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io helps me communicate with my customers across various channels, including email, SMS, and push notifications. It also makes my emails more personalized, allowing my customers to connect with me when I send them emails. It has helped me enhance my engagement with my customers and improve customer interaction with the product.

initial_reviews.review_title: An excellent and intuitive tool
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I have used Customer.io in a number of roles with different companies and clients. It has always had the right features to do excellent customer communication, build complex audiences and journeys and show the impact through easy to read reporting. The pricing tiers make it easy to get started and scale different business needs.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Not much! There are a few small timing features in the workflow builder which are a little clunky.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keeping data in sync with CRMs and other platforms - the API is exceptionally easy to use
Communicating with customers - the workflow builder and email editor are excellent
Integrations with other tools mean it covers a lot of use cases

initial_reviews.review_title: Efficient marketing email tool and excellent customer support
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
With anyone question or problem, I always have had support of the Customer.io team. I have trust with the tool for marketing email for send fast emails and structure campaigns for my customers. Customer.io haves an excellent way to segment my data base.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I would like there to be an extension of the automatic way of updating customer attributes, since attributes are important for automating processes and filters in my marketing campaigns. I have had the perception that automatic update tools do not always work efficiently.

Integration with WhatsApp through Twilio requires a more complete guide since testing the process generates many errors and failures that would not normally occur.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
I can present my offers, updates, and other information to my customers. This improve my sales with the contact of my data base.

initial_reviews.review_title: Incredibly powerful email tool with excellent workflow management features
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The ability to create separate workspaces are critical to how we use Customer.io. This functionality has seriously evolved over the last three years since I have used the platform, with efficiency and transferability key.

All of the personnel I have interacted with at Customer.io seems knowledgable and bought into me as a customer and maximising usage of their platform.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
To really get the most of the platform you will probably need a dedicated person in your team to own Customer.io and the data integrations.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to integrate into a best-in-breed email platform without having to create our own. The integrations and WYSIWYG editor are a dream to use and crucial to us being able to scale our email notifications.

initial_reviews.review_title: Attention - Dark Billing Policy - every month they charge for already deleted profile
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I like that Customer.io makes it easy to create personalized customer experiences. It allows us to quickly segment our customers based on their behavior and preferences, and then send them targeted messages that will resonate with them. The platform also makes it easy to track customer engagement and measure the success of our campaigns.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Dark Billing Policy. They charge you for customers that you already deleted. My monthly active user base have not changed, but the price increased from $2k to $4k because they count profile that I deleted more then 1 month ago.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io is solving the problem of customer segmentation, enabling businesses to better target and personalize customer communications. By using Customer.io, businesses can create customer segments based on customer data, and then segment and target customers based on their behavior and preferences, allowing for more personalized, relevant communication. This helps businesses build better relationships with their customers, increasing customer satisfaction and loyalty, and ultimately leading to increased sales and revenue.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Customer.io?
review_question_answers.answer: I like that Customer.io makes it easy to create personalized customer experiences. It allows us to quickly segment our customers based on their behavior and preferences, and then send them targeted messages that will resonate with them. The platform also makes it easy to track customer engagement and measure the success of our campaigns.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Customer.io?
review_question_answers.answer: Dark Billing Policy. They charge you for customers that you already deleted. My monthly active user base have not changed, but the price increased from $2k to $4k because they count profile that I deleted more then 1 month ago.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Customer.io is solving the problem of customer segmentation, enabling businesses to better target and personalize customer communications. By using Customer.io, businesses can create customer segments based on customer data, and then segment and target customers based on their behavior and preferences, allowing for more personalized, relevant communication. This helps businesses build better relationships with their customers, increasing customer satisfaction and loyalty, and ultimately leading to increased sales and revenue.

Customer.io plugs literally into every other tool we use, and the level of detail when segmenting people by our in platform events or various user attrubutes is fantastic. Customer support has always been great.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Sometimes some of the connectors require credentials re-autorization (say, connecting a segment to Google Ads) and there's no notification that you need to re-authorize, so periodic manual checks are requires.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have hundreds of thousands of records and extremely intricate journeys with lots of branches, personalization and various goals - customer.io helps us manage it all in one place, easily, intuitively.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
We have been using Customer.io for a couple of months now, and we have loved it. It is easy to implement, through the workflow we can easily make changes on our process as well as we validate by A/B testing new hypothesis. Also I love the customer support, everytime our team has a doubt or concer and we send an email for the support team we received great info with a fast reply which for me is very impress.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I would love if customer.io had translation to Portuguese

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We had a huge problem that for every simple modification we wanted to make in our emails and messages we had to reach for the tech team, which it was consuming time and money. And sometimes those modifications needed first to be validated, so we were stuck in many ways. Right now, we simply modify and messages in the workflow and we are ready to test, it is great!

initial_reviews.review_title: Good multitool for marketing communications, segmenting and more
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The user interface is good, you can differentiate between the different features well and understand how they work. The documentation for developers is good and most of the features have been easy to implement. When the system is linked to backend analytical events, can provide easy visual workflow builders for non-technical people as well. We have also used Customer.io to build simpler solutions for in-house processes (e.g. Slack notifications for the sales team, customer support team etc in case something happens).

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
As usually with such products that try to bite a big piece, it has a bit of a mental overhead of figuring out/learning how stuff works. But I think this is inevitable.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We don't need engineering resource so much anymore to modify transactional emails. Yes, they have to be set up initially, but afterwards, the copy etc can be tweaked by non-technical people.

We also use it for building segments and sending out marketing campaigns. It can help you build drip campaign workflows, single sends, combined campaigns that use different mediums based on prerequisites etc. A really powerful tool.

Customer.io also has helped us a lot in building fast and understanding what we're doing, especially for MVP-s and tests, where you could just build campaigns and messaging based on webhooks or other events really easily. Since the data is visual and easy to follow (open rates etc.), it is informative and can be used as a great reference point for understanding whether stuff has worked or not.

In addition to that, we've used the Slack integration to build in-house process and notify relevant teams if something important for them has happened.

initial_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool for running email campaigns (with some bonus features)
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
We are a small startup and using Customer.io mainly for marketing and onboarding campaigns.
It has been very easy to integrate with our other tools and services.

Additionally we also use it to get an overview on some user metrics, it is useful to have all information in one place.

Favorite features:
- segment graphs to monitor changes over time
- dashboard with all the important info at a glance
- workflow builder with a graph of all the steps

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Things to improve:
- A more customizable dashboard, turning it more into a user monitoring tool with segment graphs.
- Composing content in workflows (simple if-then-else conditions make content harder to read and test)
- Identify users by ids in attributes, not just the 2 default ids or email. Since every other service has their own ids you have to choose the right one carefully fom the start

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io automates our user onboarding and marketing campaigns, letting us gain and keep more users.

initial_reviews.review_title: Customer.io review
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
We have been using Customer.io for our marketing campaigns, and overall, it has proven to be a highly user-friendly and intuitive platform. The interface is well-designed, making it easy for our team to navigate and set up various campaigns to activate our customers. The flexibility to create different types of campaigns has been instrumental in tailoring our approach to effectively engage our target audience.

The ability to segment our audience and personalize messages has greatly enhanced our customer interactions. We've seen positive results in terms of customer engagement and conversion rates, thanks to the targeted campaigns we've been able to implement using Customer.io.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
We think that one area where Customer.io falls short is in its push messages system. While the platform excels in creating and managing campaigns, the analytics for push messages are lacking. This has posed challenges for our team in assessing the performance of our push campaigns accurately. We often find ourselves in the dark about the delivery status and effectiveness of our push messages.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Onboarding of clients, and personalized messaging that activate/re-activate our users

I love the ability you have to create user segments which are very useful for email targeting and analytics.
The creation & implementation of email campaigns is simple and straightforward.
You may easily integrate this tool with CRMs, and analytics tools, among others.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The metrics available for each email sent are limited. There's a huge improvement opportunity in the analytics/reporting section.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
This tool is allowing us to completely automate the email communications being sent out to our users, this includes newsletters, and offers, among other messages.
It saves our team huge amounts of time as triggers can be set up for specific actions that the users take, as well as user behavior. One of the great advantages of this tool is the possibility to create fully automated workflows that can personalize the type of content each user receives, taking into consideration the paths each user goes through.

initial_reviews.review_title: Love Customer.io !
initial_reviews.review_content:

Customer.io is an great intuitive messaging platform. What truly stands out is their customer service - it's exceptional, highly responsive, and always there to assist. Integrating data and setting up campaigns or creating messages is a breeze. Everything about the platform is straightforward and user-friendly. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an efficient and reliable messaging solution.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The only area for improvement I see in Customer.io is in the number of video tutorials available. It would be beneficial to have a greater variety of visual guides to help users navigate the platform and its various features more effectively. However, this need is somewhat mitigated by the fact that their existing documentation is well-crafted and comprehensive, providing clear guidance for users.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io has been instrumental in resolving our marketing automation challenges. It has greatly aided us in implementing our marketing strategies in a smooth, fast, and efficient manner. The platform's intuitive design and powerful features allow for effortless integration of our data and easy setup of campaigns. This has not only saved us significant time but also enhanced the effectiveness of our marketing efforts. The benefits we've experienced from using Customer.io include increased efficiency, more targeted marketing communications, and ultimately, a better return on our marketing investments

I love the ability for anyone in our organization to see what sends, to whom, when. It gives the power of creating to the author while maintaining the power of product-triggered notifications.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
It's hard to create campaigns that should revolve around dates on an object. Campaigns can only be branched on the person.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using SendGrid before was a nightmare (and I've used it at two companies). There's no visibility, even for a product manager. It's hard for engineers to search for the notification to figure out what triggers it, which makes it even harder for the company to be adaptive, test, and change.
Customer.io lets anyone see and change what's sending AND the logic behind it (that's key). It also creates the ability to test product-triggered content and provide email engagement analytics for the first time.
We've transitioned to sending transaction-like emails using campaigns. I don't see a reason to not use a campaign if you can.

all_reviews.review_title: The best all-in-one email marketing solution I've ever used.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Strongest features in my opinion: Segments and attribute system, visual workflows in campaings, API and callback support, tools for sms and push notifications.

It's easy to start if you are new to email-marketing tools, 30m onboarding is enough to start senidng.

The visual workflow system for campaigns is superior. There was only one time in 8 month of usage where the needed feature was absent, and it was implemented anyway with a workaround.

Customer support is PHENOMENAL! They reply in seconds! There wasn't even one question that I haven't recieved a answer. When there is no feature to resolve your needs on time, they recommend you a work-around and add your vote to a future feature-request.

Avaliable API and integration option list is huge. Customer.io has everything we use.

As the title says, this is really the best service in the industry. I use it every day and happy our team choosed it.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I don't really liked the new UI colors at first, but I got used to it :)

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our marketing workflows are drastically progressing with a visual workflows feature. We do not waste time and resoureses anymore to export users, we just use the atrributes and Segments feature. Email creation is much easier with WYSIWYG editor, Snippets andd Assets, although HTML wrting is also convenient with two avaliiable editors.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
It helps to make emails more personalized and allows the ability to segment users based on detailed behavior and attributes. The reporting analytics are also good because I am able to see the various activities that were carried out in the email."

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The platform was difficult to learn. It took me a while to understand how to use it. There are too many features, but it's not very user-friendly.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io helps me communicate with my customers across various channels, including email, SMS, and push notifications. It also makes my emails more personalized, allowing my customers to connect with me when I send them emails. It has helped me enhance my engagement with my customers and improve customer interaction with the product.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I have used Customer.io in a number of roles with different companies and clients. It has always had the right features to do excellent customer communication, build complex audiences and journeys and show the impact through easy to read reporting. The pricing tiers make it easy to get started and scale different business needs.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Not much! There are a few small timing features in the workflow builder which are a little clunky.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keeping data in sync with CRMs and other platforms - the API is exceptionally easy to use
Communicating with customers - the workflow builder and email editor are excellent
Integrations with other tools mean it covers a lot of use cases

all_reviews.review_title: Attention - Dark Billing Policy - every month they charge for already deleted profile
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I like that Customer.io makes it easy to create personalized customer experiences. It allows us to quickly segment our customers based on their behavior and preferences, and then send them targeted messages that will resonate with them. The platform also makes it easy to track customer engagement and measure the success of our campaigns.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Dark Billing Policy. They charge you for customers that you already deleted. My monthly active user base have not changed, but the price increased from $2k to $4k because they count profile that I deleted more then 1 month ago.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io is solving the problem of customer segmentation, enabling businesses to better target and personalize customer communications. By using Customer.io, businesses can create customer segments based on customer data, and then segment and target customers based on their behavior and preferences, allowing for more personalized, relevant communication. This helps businesses build better relationships with their customers, increasing customer satisfaction and loyalty, and ultimately leading to increased sales and revenue.

Customer.io plugs literally into every other tool we use, and the level of detail when segmenting people by our in platform events or various user attrubutes is fantastic. Customer support has always been great.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Sometimes some of the connectors require credentials re-autorization (say, connecting a segment to Google Ads) and there's no notification that you need to re-authorize, so periodic manual checks are requires.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have hundreds of thousands of records and extremely intricate journeys with lots of branches, personalization and various goals - customer.io helps us manage it all in one place, easily, intuitively.

We have been using Customer.io for a couple of months now, and we have loved it. It is easy to implement, through the workflow we can easily make changes on our process as well as we validate by A/B testing new hypothesis. Also I love the customer support, everytime our team has a doubt or concer and we send an email for the support team we received great info with a fast reply which for me is very impress.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I would love if customer.io had translation to Portuguese

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We had a huge problem that for every simple modification we wanted to make in our emails and messages we had to reach for the tech team, which it was consuming time and money. And sometimes those modifications needed first to be validated, so we were stuck in many ways. Right now, we simply modify and messages in the workflow and we are ready to test, it is great!

all_reviews.review_title: Good multitool for marketing communications, segmenting and more
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The user interface is good, you can differentiate between the different features well and understand how they work. The documentation for developers is good and most of the features have been easy to implement. When the system is linked to backend analytical events, can provide easy visual workflow builders for non-technical people as well. We have also used Customer.io to build simpler solutions for in-house processes (e.g. Slack notifications for the sales team, customer support team etc in case something happens).

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
As usually with such products that try to bite a big piece, it has a bit of a mental overhead of figuring out/learning how stuff works. But I think this is inevitable.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We don't need engineering resource so much anymore to modify transactional emails. Yes, they have to be set up initially, but afterwards, the copy etc can be tweaked by non-technical people.

We also use it for building segments and sending out marketing campaigns. It can help you build drip campaign workflows, single sends, combined campaigns that use different mediums based on prerequisites etc. A really powerful tool.

Customer.io also has helped us a lot in building fast and understanding what we're doing, especially for MVP-s and tests, where you could just build campaigns and messaging based on webhooks or other events really easily. Since the data is visual and easy to follow (open rates etc.), it is informative and can be used as a great reference point for understanding whether stuff has worked or not.

In addition to that, we've used the Slack integration to build in-house process and notify relevant teams if something important for them has happened.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool for running email campaigns (with some bonus features)
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
We are a small startup and using Customer.io mainly for marketing and onboarding campaigns.
It has been very easy to integrate with our other tools and services.

Additionally we also use it to get an overview on some user metrics, it is useful to have all information in one place.

Favorite features:
- segment graphs to monitor changes over time
- dashboard with all the important info at a glance
- workflow builder with a graph of all the steps

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Things to improve:
- A more customizable dashboard, turning it more into a user monitoring tool with segment graphs.
- Composing content in workflows (simple if-then-else conditions make content harder to read and test)
- Identify users by ids in attributes, not just the 2 default ids or email. Since every other service has their own ids you have to choose the right one carefully fom the start

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io automates our user onboarding and marketing campaigns, letting us gain and keep more users.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer.io review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
We have been using Customer.io for our marketing campaigns, and overall, it has proven to be a highly user-friendly and intuitive platform. The interface is well-designed, making it easy for our team to navigate and set up various campaigns to activate our customers. The flexibility to create different types of campaigns has been instrumental in tailoring our approach to effectively engage our target audience.

The ability to segment our audience and personalize messages has greatly enhanced our customer interactions. We've seen positive results in terms of customer engagement and conversion rates, thanks to the targeted campaigns we've been able to implement using Customer.io.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
We think that one area where Customer.io falls short is in its push messages system. While the platform excels in creating and managing campaigns, the analytics for push messages are lacking. This has posed challenges for our team in assessing the performance of our push campaigns accurately. We often find ourselves in the dark about the delivery status and effectiveness of our push messages.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Onboarding of clients, and personalized messaging that activate/re-activate our users

all_reviews.review_title: One of the best email marketing tools out there
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I love the ability you have to create user segments which are very useful for email targeting and analytics.
The creation & implementation of email campaigns is simple and straightforward.
You may easily integrate this tool with CRMs, and analytics tools, among others.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The metrics available for each email sent are limited. There's a huge improvement opportunity in the analytics/reporting section.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
This tool is allowing us to completely automate the email communications being sent out to our users, this includes newsletters, and offers, among other messages.
It saves our team huge amounts of time as triggers can be set up for specific actions that the users take, as well as user behavior. One of the great advantages of this tool is the possibility to create fully automated workflows that can personalize the type of content each user receives, taking into consideration the paths each user goes through.

all_reviews.review_title: Love Customer.io !
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io is an great intuitive messaging platform. What truly stands out is their customer service - it's exceptional, highly responsive, and always there to assist. Integrating data and setting up campaigns or creating messages is a breeze. Everything about the platform is straightforward and user-friendly. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an efficient and reliable messaging solution.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The only area for improvement I see in Customer.io is in the number of video tutorials available. It would be beneficial to have a greater variety of visual guides to help users navigate the platform and its various features more effectively. However, this need is somewhat mitigated by the fact that their existing documentation is well-crafted and comprehensive, providing clear guidance for users.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io has been instrumental in resolving our marketing automation challenges. It has greatly aided us in implementing our marketing strategies in a smooth, fast, and efficient manner. The platform's intuitive design and powerful features allow for effortless integration of our data and easy setup of campaigns. This has not only saved us significant time but also enhanced the effectiveness of our marketing efforts. The benefits we've experienced from using Customer.io include increased efficiency, more targeted marketing communications, and ultimately, a better return on our marketing investments

all_reviews.review_title: Finally a way for non-engineers to visualize notifications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I love the ability for anyone in our organization to see what sends, to whom, when. It gives the power of creating to the author while maintaining the power of product-triggered notifications.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
It's hard to create campaigns that should revolve around dates on an object. Campaigns can only be branched on the person.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using SendGrid before was a nightmare (and I've used it at two companies). There's no visibility, even for a product manager. It's hard for engineers to search for the notification to figure out what triggers it, which makes it even harder for the company to be adaptive, test, and change.
Customer.io lets anyone see and change what's sending AND the logic behind it (that's key). It also creates the ability to test product-triggered content and provide email engagement analytics for the first time.
We've transitioned to sending transaction-like emails using campaigns. I don't see a reason to not use a campaign if you can.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
CUstomer.io facilitates the creation of multi-channel communication flows and precise customer segments. Thanks to the platform, we can easily manage our communication plan and multiple recurring communication flows. The platform is highly intuitive and quick to learn. Updates and improvements are made frequently, and their support team is very responsive!

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The only downside I can think of is mainly due to the complexity of our product that can make it sometimes hard to create some communication flows.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io enables us to create communication flows very quickly, with precise segmentation. This means we can easily create communications with the right targeting or in response to customer behaviors almost instantaneously. This means we can communicate with our customer base without the need for any special development and we can crate a healthy lifecycle for our customers that brings engagement and a steady revenue flow.

- very simple and friendly integration with business internal tools
- built in Customer Data Platform
- possibility of advanced segmentation of the customer base

If your company is data driven and you'd like to take advantage of that, customer.io is one of those tools that will allow you to get the most out of your data.

all_reviews.review_content:

I did not have to watch any tutorial besides 1 to add content to an email campaign. It's quite userfriendly, I can understand it by scanning.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The different flows I have to create can sometimes look confusing. The visual layout of email campaigns are helpful but I wish I could hover each node and see the content of each email without having to click into it to see the full size. I do not like clicking on too many things unecessarily because I'm worried to break any existing flows I or someone else had created.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Bringing people back into our product and creating a halthy cadence for that. I've also used it for releasing new features and inviting people to try them out. Drip campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer.io helped us increase our week over week retention by 3x.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io has been a game-changer in our user engagement and marketing strategy. Its standout feature is its adaptability to seamlessly integrate with various tech stacks and its support for webhooks, giving you unparalleled control over your messaging. By harnessing their event-driven marketing capabilities, we were able to precisely target users throughout their customer journey. This strategic approach led to remarkable results, including a substantial boost in product creation, sales, and a 3x increase in customer retention rates.

Furthermore, it's worth noting that the company continues to expand its product offerings, making it a pleasant surprise for users as they can consider migrating not only their messaging but also their entire tech and data stack to Customer.io.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
One potential challenge with this product is its technical requirements, which might pose a slight learning curve for non-technical users, especially within departments like marketing, growth, finance, and sales.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We initially turned to Customer.io to address our retention challenges, and it certainly delivered on that front. However, what pleasantly surprised us was its versatility in solving a multitude of business problems across our organization. This included optimizing our users' average order value by promoting upgrades from our standard SaaS plan to premium options, driven by their interactions with our product. Additionally, we harnessed its capabilities to automate lead generation through our website, seamlessly integrating it with Webflow to nurture leads without the need for immediate involvement from Account Executives or Sales Development Representatives until genuine interest was demonstrated.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing for campaigns and personalisation, tricky for the nitty gritty
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io makes it:

- Really easy to segment users by different attributes, dates, events and much more
- The ability to use liquid makes it easy to customise emails to a huge extent
- Auto-creation of UTM makes it easy to track clicks, and further customisation can be added manually for really granular tracking
- The Overview makes it easy to track opens/clicks/conversions/bounces/unsubs, both for the campaign as a whole and for individual emails/texts/push notifications
- When you don't have the attribute or data you need, it's easy to build your own campaigns just to add / update attributes
- The Preference centre makes it easier to keep users around, since they can choose to unsubscribe only from one topic. It can also make it easier to see which types of emails prompt the most unsubscriptions
- Updating and deleting users is simple and secure
- Many different ways to get information into customer.io (our own platform, Zapier, Typeform etc.)
- Creating and uploading manual segments is very easy

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
- Duplication tracking can be very difficult, as there isn't anything built in to notify you of a person with a duplicate email in the workspaces where 'id' is the unique value
- Personalised send-times and 'wait until not contacted in' requires a lot of hacking and extra work to get right
- There isn't quite enough complexity in the tutorials and use-cases, so often you can't find a specific answer to the thing you're looking for. Especially where it comes to liquid.
- Workspaces don't communicate, and there isn't a good way to make them do so. It means it can be hard to track duplicates across work-spaces, and make sure a user isn't receiving two very different types of comms across two work-spaces
- Integration with some external platforms is a bit clunky and time-consuming
- When merging users, you're not allowed to select individual attributes you would like to keep from the secondary user, if you'd like them to over-write the primary user you're merging them into

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io makes it easy for us to send the majority of our comms from within one space, meaning we don't get comms overwhelm / fatigue as easily for our users. It's also very easy to track a users recent activity by looking at what comms they received, and how they acted, next to any events coming in and attributes changing. So it saves us a lot of customer support team time on automated reminders / chasers / follow-ups, and also makes the user's comms experience better overall.

all_reviews.review_title: One of the most incredible software product that I've ever used
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
First the support team is incredible, I always get quick response and very proffesional.
I like the capabilities of this product, the flexibility and being able to get much more than a regular email marketing platform.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The most downside that we encounter in our company using Cutomer.io is the process of designing and creating the emails and exporting it from Figma to CIO.
We want to be able editing the design/copy outside from the platform to make it easier on our copy writer and designer, and it's quite a headace to moving it from Figma to CIO.

Other than that we missed a feature of:
1. Conditional action with an "or" logic.
2. A way to see easy mapping between campaign id and action id to the names of the campaigns/email actions.
3. Being able to see metrics on campaigns by filtering out our test emails

We encounter few bugs from time to time but that's understandable and as long as we get the support it's fine.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io is helping us follow up on new leads and convert them to customers,
Help us with communicate active customers and notify them about their membership and reminders of their sessions
And to manage their activities and information.
And from time to time we send a newsletter to our subcribrs.

all_reviews.review_title: Game changer for automating customer and onboarding messages!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Super useful to create flows and trigger based campaigns. It's almost like playing with Legos where once you have enough building blocks set it, the entire flow or campaigns will work like magic. On top of that you can A/B test subjects or email copies like a piece of cake!

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
While the tool is an absolute beast, some little caveats like not being able to know what devices the emails are opened and read on can be a slight deal breaker. It still doesn't take away from the advantages, but there are tiny things that would truly boost the usefulness of Customer.io, but I'm positive that the team is working on these features silently!

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
All our onboarding emails are automated to the last step of a user journey, but it's incredibly easy to change things around and A/B testing where necessary. I'd have imagined that automating emails would be difficult, but customer.io has made it look like child's play.

all_reviews.review_title: Best mkt. automation & messaging tool I worked with
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
In the first place it was very easy to start using it. We made the switch from Hubspot to Customer.io because Hubspot is more designed for sales-led organisations while we focus on product-led as a low-ticket SaaS business. The implemenation was very easy. I find the ease of integrating events (from Segment in our case) & attributes very helpful. Also the amount of flexibility in configuring triggers & segments based on these events & attributes is one of the reasons I like Customer.io. Something I've not experienced in tools I worked with before. The UX is also very good, probably that's why I'm logging in into Customer.io once a day at least. I did not had many support requests but when I need it the support is always fast.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I would love to see in-app messages getting more advanced so we could configure both our onboarding e-mailflows and in-app product tours in the same tool.

It would also be nice if the Analytics dashboarding could be more flexible in the future so we can also measure product stats in Customer.io.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Building marketing automation flows throughout the customer journey.

all_reviews.review_title: Comprehensive all-in-one communication solution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
We have been using Customer.io for over a year now, and we have been extremely happy with the ease of use, simple setup (good documentation), and comprehensive native integrations. Before switching to customer.io, we tested a range of other providers, but none of them provided all the features we were looking for; some were too simple, whereas others were too complicated for no reason. We now use customer.io every day for all of our communications with our clients. Although we did not need it as much, their customer support is very good, I was especially impressed with their proactive approach to a potential billing issue.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
This is not something that I don't like right now per se, but something that I'm a bit concerned about is the pricing structure that seems to be slowly changing over time and might make, an otherwise excellent service, not viable for certain business models or startups.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
They provide consistent, comprehensive and customizable communications with clients through various mediums.

They also utilize one of the best drag-and-drop email editors I've ever used, which makes putting together beautiful mobile friendly templates very easy.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?

all_reviews.review_title: My favorite platform for Product Led Growth (PLG) and Marketing Automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
- Attractive Pricing for B2C businesses (with a lot of users)
- User friendly
- Very developer-friendly and transparent in terms of data
- Very flexible with many integrations, webhooks and very advanced personalization and data modifications that can be implemented using either Liquid or Javacript
- Supports various channels: Email, mobile push notifications, in-app news, SMS or WhatsApp (via Twilio) and even more through webhooks
- Pricing is not based on user seats which fosters collaboration
- Customer.io now even has a 2nd great product: Customer.io Data Pipelines (CDP)

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
- The WYSIWYG email editor is missing template features (but it has re-usable rows)

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Onboarding of new users of our SaaS product, increase engagement of existing users, feature upselling based on deep insights about the user, re-engage or survey inactive users.

all_reviews.review_title: Great platform for segmentation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I love customer.io for grouping my audiences together and creating automatic and manual segments. Sending broadcasts is similar to most other mailout platforms I've used, so it's easy to switch to using the platform without too much learning time.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The only things I'd add to improve Customer.io is the ability to add notes to a record so it can serve as our one -stop-shop for our CRM data, and secondly, the ability to bulk update attributes.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io allows us to have multiple lists in one account, separated by workspace - so this helps keep things clearer. It's great that it integrates with so many platforms, as actions taken by our customers mean their attributes and segments are automatically updated. This takes a lot of the labour out of keeping lists up to date.

all_reviews.review_title: Simply the best
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
CustomerIO is an amazing platform that has really unlocked email & messaging automation for us.

I'd recommend it above all other tools that we use.

What I like
- Ability to create very powerful campaigns without any developer resource
- Ability to connect all other softwares / tools directly to CIO
- Amazing UX/UI compared to other email automation platforms I've used in the past
- Support team always available to help
- Very flexible tool
- Very easy to 'audit' and see what's happened and why - following users through journeys

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Honestly very very little.

If there was one thing, I find it's in-app messenger very basic.

Would also be amazing if I could integrate my clients' Slacks with CIO, and not just my own.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Send automated event-triggered campaigns to users (e.g. user does X in product, send email Y)
- Send automated segment-triggered campaigns to users (e.g. user has attributes A, B and C, send email D)
- Send newsletters (e.g. June Product Newsletter)

all_reviews.review_title: An ideal Email / Messaging Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io's advanced campaign automation and ability to easily segment customers are its biggest advantages over its competitors. It is extremely simple to use but there is also so much depth to what you can achieve within the system, should you want something more advanced. Their customer service team and quick, knowledgeable, and friendly - they always either answer my question directly, help me in finding a solution, or let me know that a feature is not currently available but has been added to their 'open request for a feature' list.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
No platform covers everything you want it to do, in the way that you want it to do it.... and this is no different for customer.io. As per my 'What do you like best about Customer.io?' comments, I love the fact that they add any request for features that are not currently available to their 'open request for a feature' list, but I would also like more visibility on the progress of these - what their current priority is, how each new one will help me as a user, and where my feature requests sit within this back-log.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation / campaign management - being able to easily fire off emails based on customer actions.

all_reviews.review_title: Couldn't live without it
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io is my go-to tool for tons of communication automation processes. The integration with Segment works like a charm, and there are tons of opportunities to customize flows in any way that I want. I've recommended customer.io to many friends and others in the industry who have all been very happy with it.

As a massive bonus, customer.io's support team is amazing. Any time I have any question or challenge that I need to overcome, I ask them, and someone thoughtful and intelligent always responds quickly with a detailed answer.

Couldn't recommend this tool more.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I'd love them to invest a bit more in the in-app popup feature that they launched this year, so I can also use customer.io for various in-app flows.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io helps me communicate with customers for any type of message that I need to tell them. It integrates with all the data sources that I need, has tons of flexibility into how I build workflows, and never really has any bugs.

It saves me tons of time, since I outsource so much to this tool.

I'm also very confident trying new things and setting up new proccesses, because I can always rely on their incredible support team to help me with anything I need.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer.io improved the way we're interacting with our customer in a modern way.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The platform is modern, and is connected to a lot of kind of communication channels (SMS, emails, slack messages, tracking systems).
There are a good customer success manager who tries to help you improving your marketing automation and give you some feedbacks from the industry.
We can plug our website and our mobile application to the same tool and follow the customer journeys.
The integration of Bigquery is very useful and easy.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Nothing really. The tool is working perfectly, but maybe using their SDK is the only way to generate some KPI from the application.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Generating KPI, Following customer journeys, creating workflow to onboard people in marketing automation is something really easy to do and it's a scalable. You can do a marketing automation in 3 clicks after having segmented your users, then you will follow your KPI, doing A/B testing... etc.
You're totally free and autonomous to synchronize the data you want in the system. The data can be whatever you want and you can update it whenever you want.
A really modern tool to use.

I appreciate the easiness of use of the messaging system. The user interface is intuitive and straightforward, which makes it easy to navigate and understand.

One of the things that I particularly like about the messaging system is the ability to design a tree of messages. This feature allows me to create a sequence of messages that are automatically sent to users based on their segment or actions.

Another feature that I find very helpful is the push notification system. The push notifications are very fast to send, which means that my users receive them almost instantly.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Amm, I think it's the in-app messages but to give them a break it's a newly developed feature but they should make the design interface easier than that and add more ready template to help

The messaging system is designed to follow up with users through push notifications, keeping everyone updated on important information. In addition, it provides encouragement to users who have achieved goals and alerts those who are approaching renewal or have been inactive

all_reviews.review_title: Both User Friendly and Powerful
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io is a very user friendly and powerful marketing automation platform. The UI is intuitive, integrations easy - and supported by great documentation and customer account support.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The only downside to Customer.io is the licensing being based on records created regardless of activation. Other nice to haves would be native integrations to more commonly used digital tools.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
The roadmap to CDP is very intriguing. The EU data centre is lagging behind on this front so we have yet to actually demo this service with our own data or understand licensing/costs but the roadmap looks very strong as this could replace adding another CDP tool to our architecture.

all_reviews.review_title: 10/10 would recommend
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
After the initial setup, we were able to significantly reduce the engineering time that was previously spent on email. We have a small team so it's incredibly valuable to us that the marketing team is able to autonomously build, edit, and execute emails without a heavy engineering lift. I can go on for a long time about the features I love in Customer.io that have made my life SO easy, such as the wait until block, the update/add person, the code editor, snippets, etc, etc!!! The product is also intuitive and fun.

We could have gone with the self-serve plan to reduce cost, but I'm soooo glad we invested in the plan that gets us priority tech support and a dedicated CSM. I'm a big, big fan of everyone I've interacted with so far about any issue or question, their team is lovely.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The only downside I can think of right now is the metrics/data. I understand it's hard with ESPs to report accurate open/click rates now, due to email clients having new privacy policies. I do think the Dashboard/Analysis pages could be a significant area that CIO could improve in to stand out from other tools that are more data-driven.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reduced the cost we were spending on Braze
Significantly reduced dependence on our engineering team
Ideas that were just on a Figjam board yesterday becomes a reality through Customer.io today!

all_reviews.review_title: The most flexible (and complete) messaging platform to convert users
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The direct and live integration of customer.io with our data sources is robust and enables us to trigger messages to the right users at the right time.

We were able to build and manage complex messaging scenarios that contribute to business growth thanks to key features, such as their campaign editor and their visual workflow builder. The platform's flexibility and anallytics also enables us to handle multiple and varied use cases, including: onboarding free users, converting customers, preventing churn, and delighting promoters.

I appreciate how the company values and listens to its customers when it comes to product research, feature releases, and customer support. The recent release of their custom objects, in-app messaing and data pipelines makes me think that the platform could become the market leader over the next decade. Having used other messaging platform in the past, I feel happy to use such an innovative product on a daily basis!

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Still some email delivarbility discrepancies noticed for some reasons (could be linked to our own settings and our email code). But nothing else negative to say about my experience with Customer.io.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
The platform enables us to send messages to users and customers at the optimal time. It allows in onboarding new users, personalizing communication for each persona, fast tracking customer conversions, delighting promoters, and preventing churn.
Additionally, it allows us to measure and report conversions with ease. Initially, we constructed our PLG motion and alerts exclusively using Customer.io.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent marketing automation software that goes way beyond automated emails
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The integration using Segment as a data source works perfectly.
The flow to create campaigns is extremely complete. The ceiling for customer.io's possibilities is extremely high, which allows a ton of flexibility.
Customer.io as a product constantly evolves towards a more robust one. Recent acquisitions and additions further expanded the offering.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Honestly I don't have anything negative to say about Customer.io. We've been using it for more than 5 years now and never even considered exploring alternatives. The only pain point I had was the lack of support for Segment's Group call (aka managing Companies in addition to Users in Customer.io), but that has been fixed with the recent addition of Organization objects (and actually, Customer.io added Custom objects which allow for way more flexibility than just Orgs).

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are a Product-led growth company, and accurately messaging our users at important times of their lifecycle is central to our business. We also rely on Customer.io for simple campaigns sent by the marketing team. Last but not least, we've set up quite a few non-messaging related campaigns over the years. This flexibility has been incredibly useful as our company and headcount grew. It often saved us a lot of $ to use Customer.io as a first MVP before taking a dedicated tool (ex: we relied on Customer.io to assign leads to our sales on our CRM before moving to a bespoke solution with Salesforce).

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
My team and I are big fans of Customer.io. In our opinion, it's one of the best tools available in the martech space, and here's why:

It's incredibly powerful and supports a heavy user base with reliable delivery.
Customer.io is a platform that continues to evolve at a rapid pace. Currently, it offers an extensive range of integrations for both data inflow and outflow. Not to mention, it also features a Beta CDP and all the standard capabilities you would expect from a tool of this calibre.
The pricing is excellent. Comparable tools on the market often charge twice as much for similar functionality.
We've experimented with several other options, including Braze, Autopilot, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud, but we firmly believe that Customer.io is the superior choice.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I can't pinpoint any significant drawbacks with Customer.io at the moment. However, if I were to offer a suggestion, it would be that Customer.io needs to start integrating AI processes soon. These could be used to predict and optimize the goals of user journeys or flows, as well as to enhance the copywriting for messages and emails using AI tools.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Essentially, I believe that Customer.io excels at solving the core problem of omnichannel automation. Moreover, they tackle this issue in a flexible and robust manner. The platform offers a multitude of options for debugging and testing, along with various ways to handle data, such as user properties, transactional event data, and collections. Lastly, they provide a straightforward method to integrate any medium through the use of webhooks.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent marketing automation software with reasonable pricing, suitable for startups
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
It's powerful, flexible, and yet, easy to use. It covers all necessary channels such as email, push, in-app, SMS, and webhooks. The workflow builder is excellent. All of that comes at a price that works for a startup. Support is very good.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The mail templating system requires tech skills if you want anything beyond the basics. That said, I have yet to see a significantly better system -- email is a bitch, always has been. What I seriously dislike is that they charge for dormant user profiles.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Any communication with our mobile users goes through CIO, essentially being the one-stop shop. Everything is personalized, event-driven, automated and deeply integrated into our customer data platform. Also, through webhooks, the communication is bi-directional, allowing a unified view of the user's activity.

all_reviews.review_title: Good CRM, but needs polish.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I like that I can use it as both a data tool as well as an email CRM. We've been able to create segments of consumers based on our actions/events/messages that we would not have been able to otherwise.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I feel like the "Metric" section in the workflow is slow sometimes. Also, I really wish I could segment a segment instead of having to try another way to find people who overlap two segments. But mostly, I hate that I cannot add more than one Facebook Ad account.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We want to email our vast number of users at scale, and CIO does that intuitively with a good UI/UX. This makes me more productive at work by giving me leverage over my communications with our list.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer.io A Great Tool For Customer Engagement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io is a very user-friendly interface that is simple for anyone to use and navigate, regardless of technical proficiency. Segmentation and Personalization: The platform includes strong segmentation and personalization features that enable precise targeting and have increased audience engagement. Automation: We have saved a tonne of time and effort by streamlining our marketing activities, allowing us to nurture leads more efficiently, and re-engaging users.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Although Customer.io offers excellent value, it might not be the most cost-effective choice for many enterprises. Pricing for startups or smaller businesses may be a little pricey.
Overall, the advantages exceed any disadvantages, and Customer.io has emerged as a key resource for our customer interaction initiatives.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We used to send general messages to all of our customers, which frequently led to low engagement and conversion rates. We can segment our audience using Customer.io depending on their behaviour, demographics, and other factors, allowing us to deliver them communications that are highly relevant and targeted. Benefit: As a result, open rates, click-through rates, and conversion rates have significantly increased, ultimately increasing income.

all_reviews.review_title: Integrated events and flexible segment building capabilities automate highly specific outreach

With customer.io we have been able to automate communication sequences to specific groups of people through leveraging the integrated events, segments, and campaigns. Additionally, we can ensure people exit the campaigns appropriately with thoughtful branching and event conditions.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Drafting communications can be tedious and sorting through the library of previously drafted communications is not always straightforward.

The clarity of the documentation, especially the REST API one.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
That when reaching the contract's max number of customers the needed deletions cannot be automatically triggered via eviction rules, nor handled seemlessly via the BigQuery integration.

all_reviews.review_title: Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I like how intuituve the platform is, and it's very helpful because I need to take care of CRM with very minimal marketing and engineering knowledge. The guideline documentations are very clear and easy to navigate. Pricing seems reasonable so far.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I have yet to run into any major inconveniences, but there was slight confusion with setting the campaign message via "campaigns" and "content". I'd naturally start a campaign and build a message on that interface, later to find out I should have used the message library instead to keep using the same message on a different campaign.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have only just started with automated messages for customer experience, so the service is meeting all our needs at the moment. The best problem that it's solving would be pricing; famous tools out there have too many features that we don't really need and charge so much. But Customer.io gives us the very key features we need at a reasonable price.

all_reviews.review_title: Supercharged our lifecycle marketing program
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Here are my 3 favorite things about C.io:

World-Class User Segmentation: C.io simplifies user cohort creation and segmentation based on attributes/events

Transparent Email Metrics: C.io provides transparency into email metrics, including deliverability, open rates, click-through rates, and bounce classification (i.e. soft vs. hard). We've found this super valuable when it comes to diagnosing delivery/engagement issues.

Automation: C.io has an intuitive automation system with a user-friendly UX/UI, making it accessible to users of all skill levels. Setting up automated campaigns is a breeze!

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The most challenging thing about C.io is the lack of a canonical A/B testing log. It's difficult to keep track of stat sig test results - you need to track everything in a sheet or powerpoint. Hopefully this makes it onto their product roadmap at some point!

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io is mainly helping us solve the challenges of marketing personalization based on user activity/attributes, rapidly A/B testing our marketing emails, and automating our marketing comms. This has benefitted us by removing lots of manual work and supercharging our targeting efforts to help drive down acquisition costs.

Automation: C.io has an intuitive automation system with a user-friendly UX/UI, making it accessible to users of all skill levels. Setting up automated campaigns is a breeze!

all_reviews.review_title: Best-in-class tool to manage communication with customers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Easy to setup and powerful feature set: works with most communication channels and allows for tracking & reporting on everything.
Customer support is responsive and generally useful.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Some simple yet important features are missing: automatic BCC on all emails for CRM integrations, clear formatting in rich text editor
CIO is not super easy to pick up for people without technical knowledge -- there are a lot of settings that need to be set for each campaign/broadcast and require training

Some key aspects of the CIO for us are under-developed: Zapier integration does the bare minimum (2 endpoints, no error messages...) and the API documentation can be misleading

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Centralizing our communication to customers across all channels. Personalizing communication at scale. Top-notch deliverability and end-to-end performance tracking.

Action ability and flexibility, even for users that are lacking an engineeering background. It gives us more than enough freedom to set up workflows, communications, and API calls with ease and a very customer friendly product. Whenever there's a problem, the customer support team is ready to jump in.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Al thought they are very helpful and emphatic when dealing with any cases their support teams are located in the United States, which makes it difficult for us in Europe to have short resolution times. The problems are normally complex and require multiple interactions so this makes the resolution times even longer.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our Operations team has benefited a lot from the flexibility and easiness of the platform. We have developed workflows that jump from one tool to the other thanks to the webhook functionalities so we are able to manage both our operational and communicational workflows together.

all_reviews.review_title: Smooth product that has all the tools you need
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io knows how peole work with tracking events and makes its email flow suite integrate very well with it. It's straight forward.

While I struggled a bit at first, it is actually the first email automation tool where I managed to create dynamic emails by myself using the coding logic

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
There are only few quality of life things that sometimes I stumble upon that are not that thought through. For example if I add a segment, I can only delete the entire segment - not remove individual users from the segment.

Also, the documentation for coding logic in emails could be improved. It took me quite some time to get to a state where the emai worked the way I expected.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using Customer.io to create drip email campaigns that are highly tailored to the user's profile and actions in the platform. Also, we are sending our product updates and newsletters via Customer.io.

all_reviews.review_title: Comprehensive marketing automation without extra fluff
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Super easy to use on both one-off marketing sends as well as more complex campaigns. Data pulls seem accurate and it's pretty easy to parse through data and use campaigns to update/create new attributes, segment accurately, etc. Support is next level- I can always get a quick response from my account manager or live chat.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I feel like CIO is marketed as a tool that doesn't require a ton of engineering resources, but I haven't found this to be the case fully in our situation. Without really solid upfront investment from eng, we've really not taken full advantage and some features (collections, managing our API and some integrations, etc) simply can't happen without engineering support.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We need to regularly send both one-to-one and one-to-many communications to a growing user base with specific interests and use cases. CIO allows us to do this seamlessly because data is accurate and up to date and the UI is simple- I can throw together a last minute campaign in minutes. It allows our lean team to go beyond the Mailchimp mentality of sending one-off emails to better personalize each user's communications.

all_reviews.review_title: Solid 1:1 marketing platform with great customer service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io has the core functionality and channel mix a 1:1 marketing platform needs. It's easy to use and has most of the relevant integrations a marketer requires. Their segment integration is seamless and makes setup painless. Their customer and technical support teams are timely with responses and are open to feedback on improving their products and services.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Customer.io's mobile channels are still relatively new, so the functionality is less robust than some direct competitors. Some smaller quality of life features could be built out to make a difference, but our CSM has been receptive to this feedback.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io allows us to reach our customers promptly and effectively using email and push notifications. The platform's integration with Snowflake and metrics export functionality allows us to analyze performance using external BI tools.

all_reviews.review_title: Super flexible with great Customer Service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io makes it easy to set up rather complex campaign workflows with emails in multiple languages and conditional logic - even for users without any coding knowledge. The integration with our CRM platform was easy and flexible, and it is easy to monitor and debug if needed. We expand our communication by adding new events to automatically trigger new flows.

The Customer Success Manager ensured a great start and provided continued support. They listen to our issues, pain points, and new ideas - and more than once, newly launched features solved problems or enabled new flows.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The only SMS integration out-of-the-box is through Twilio, which is not the best (or cheapest) vendor in our market. Customer.io's flexibility gave us the option to build an SMS integration via webhooks with the vendor of our choice, but it is much more complicated to set up than emails.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a subscription-based business, it is important to communicate with our members at the most relevant times and with the most relevant content. With Customer.io, we can trigger based on our members' behavior in both the digital and physical worlds and build elaborate communication flows to different segments with a high degree of granularity. This ensures that the right messages reach the right customer at the right time. Currently, we mostly use the email channel, but we are planning on expanding into SMS and push notifications.
