all_reviews.review_title: Amazing tool with sea of possibilities
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
CSio works very intuitively and I have been able to create any campaign I could imagine. It is very clear how the tool works and the customer support is super helpful. The documentation is a great resource and I have gained some inspiration from their community pages. They keep adding new features very frequently and our campaigns have benefitted from it greatly! A big plus: I'm not great at coding myself, so it's really nice that I can work on my own in CSio without needing a developer.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
With all the new features that are being added, it can be hard to keep up and keep going back to older campaigns to update them. While it is nice that I don't need our developers to work with CSio, sometimes a campaign can get very complicated. It would be nice to have some more guidance in the tool. That being said the CS team is very willing to help whenever I'm stuck.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
CSio allows me to segment our users very easily and create personalized campaigns. The drag-and-drop e-mail builder helps me create great looking e-mails without needing developers or knowledge of coding. This is a huge timesaver for our marketing team.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer.io for a D2C health app
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The ability to craft and send highly personalized data-driven emails, push notifications, in-app messages, and SMS has empowered us to engage our audience with precision and relevance. The platform's intuitive interface and comprehensive automation features have simplified our workflow, saving us valuable time and effort.

One of the standout features of Customer.io is its unparalleled control and flexibility. The powerful segmentation and targeting capabilities have enabled us to tailor our messaging to specific customer segments, resulting in higher engagement rates and conversions. Moreover, the platform's A/B testing functionality has allowed us to fine-tune our campaigns and optimize their performance.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
There is nothing we dislike about Customer.io. Sometimes we've had to jump on a call with the Customer.io team in order to figure out how to use a certain feature or integration, but our experience has been seamless otherwise!

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io solves critical problems for us and provides significant benefits. It enables us to effectively reach and engage our target audience, increasing customer interactions and conversions. The platform's robust automation features streamline our workflow, saving us time and effort. The ability to craft personalized, data-driven messages across multiple channels ensures relevance and resonance. Customer.io's powerful segmentation and targeting capabilities allow us to tailor campaigns, boosting engagement rates. Additionally, the platform's A/B testing functionality helps optimize performance. The exceptional customer support ensures a smooth experience, addressing any concerns promptly. Overall, Customer.io empowers us to maximize our marketing efforts, driving success and achieving our goals.

all_reviews.review_title: Phenomenal product, even better customer experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Their customer experience hands down. Joe Chen is the best CS rep I've worked with across any company ever. Period. He's gone out of his way to make our CIO experience delightful, answered emails at odd hours, and even given us product feedback. Even if there were a better product out there (we haven't come across one), we'd stay on with CIO just for this experience.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
More templates focused on PLG use cases. We're a product led growth company. Would love to have successful templates from other companies that we can quickly rinse and repeat (onboarding, re-engagement etc.). The current ones feel too generic. This is a nit though.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email follow ups (onboarding sequence)
Use re-engagement
Personalized campaigns
Follow up surveys
Broadcast emails
ANd much more!

all_reviews.review_title: Experienced Customer.io User
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
This is your all-in-one system to communicate with your customers. Instead of having multiple systems to push, email, text or otherwise communicate, Customer.io makes it easy to set every system up and get your messaging out. Analytics are also terrific.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I do not have any issues as a Customer.io user. However, we did need the developer to help set up the initial stages of our account. After that, with the general knowledge of how a communication system works, we've been crushing it!

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keeping all of our communication aligned and in one place! It's very easy to use, and the analytics in the automation are terrific. You can tell exactly where people are in their journey, and where they are falling off.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for customer engagement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Their workflows are quite good and give you a lot of options in terms of how to structure the customer journey. The connection with our Postgres database worked extremely smoothly as well.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
They have many limitations, especially when compared to tools like Intercom. The fact that I can't add as many columns to my customer view as I'd like is one of them. The fact that I can't connect blocks in the workflow is a major downside as well, and I hope they add more native integrations in the future.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps us engage with our users in a personalized way, targeting specific customer segments and talking to the users in the key moments o their journey to become customers.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io is very good at all things related to customer messaging and has been expanding its capabilities rapidly since we started using them two years ago. It is incredible and may replace our CDP shortly.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
There are some specific limitations to the way that campaigns and workflow steps can be triggered or updated by events that I think could be more intuitive and useful.

There are workarounds, but this is one of the most painful things we encounter.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
All of our marketing and transactional email and some push and SMS messaging is handled with Customer.io. Its very quick to get set up and has been fairly accessible to non-technical folks on our team to get value from it.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer.io Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I enjoy the customizing that customer.io offers with their liquid and event setup. You can almost create anything you're hoping for message-wise with the right combination of event data and liquid. The live chat is also beneficial if you ever get stuck and need quick help with an email, segment or metrics.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
There are some limitations in the analytics and segment building. It can be difficult to troubleshoot and find answers with the analytics dashboards. Also the new Parcel email editor will get a little buggy and log out during each edit sometimes.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io makes it really easy to create and launch a campaign. The interface is very user-friendly, so with some aspects, any person could jump in and create a campaign or broadcast as needed. We also have several instances where we need attachments on emails and the Transactional email option makes it easy to work with your engineering teams to accomplish that.

all_reviews.review_title: The cornerstone of our marketing team
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Overall power of the platform and collaboration tools. Switching to Customer.io has allowed my team to move from requiring dev time to launch each automated email to being able to launch and A/B test emails in minutes.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Campaigns and workflows can very quickly become cluttered. It's possible to build out very complex solutions through Customer.io, but at a certain point they require multiple campaigns and attributes to run.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Customer.io to send emails to prospects as they become users and evangelists. Through syncing users with our database and triggering events from our platform, we're able to send timely notifications to our users. It also allows us to stand up new campaigns without relying on our engineering team.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The downside of the application is the lack of ability to be to send an email within a workflow at a specific date and time. An example of this would be sending an email the day before an event.

Customer.io allows me to automate a large number of processes that would otherwise require constant manual management. These include transactional emails, and in particular, marketing sequences, running across multiple months of the year.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Customer.io?

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool, very intuitive and powerfull
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
- All in one tool (email management, sms, push, webhooks to send anything)
- Customer segmentation (very precise customer segmentation)
- The UI ! very convenient, thanks

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
- Very great analysis tool (knowing it's not the tool main mission) but complicated to get report per user instead of per message
- Not possible to get the limit rate option in the campaigns AND the fact that in the broadcast you can't chose to not send the communication during special hours
- Transactional emails !! having to re-create it from one workspace to another...
(apart from that, we're very happy about it)

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Having one tool for all those channels, very convenient.
Being able to send webhooks to generate outgoing calls, push notifications (for our partners)
thanks all !

all_reviews.review_title: CIO marketing platform review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io has a lot of functionality to be an entirely self-service tool for marketing automation. We used it to send SMS and Email out on behalf of our clients and were happy with the results.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Its a little on the technical side to ensure that the segments and triggers are set up correctly to deliver the right messages to the right people. We had some issues with timestamps as attributes and trying to trigger campaigns based off of them.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
It solves the programming of message delivery. instead of tasking engineering with hard coding message templates and events to trigger those templates, this enables us to move quicker to implement and deploy these marketing campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Great email marketing platform for data-driven communications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io makes it easy for our developers to get our customer data actions into the platform. That allows our marketing team to create complex email workflows without doing one-off uploads or asking developers to do one-off projects. The data model is simple and effective (with user attributes + triggered events + page views). It provides the necessary information to create compelling emails and well-time customer journeys.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The WYSIWYG email builder has improved significantly over the years, but it can still feel cumbersome and hasn't supported reusable components as well as I would like.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io helps solve the problem of how to reach the rights users with the right information at the right time -- without constant engineering support.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
As a WordPress developer, Customer.io was extremely easy to integrate into our website. I entered our own Contact Us webpage URL into the Customer.io wizard, and Customer.io replied with some JavaScript to add to our page to enable the contact form to send data to Customer.io.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Sometimes I had difficulty getting rid of old forms. If I wanted to update the parameters of our form's connection with Customer.io, often Customer.io would revert to what it saw when first presented with the form URL.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io solves our need for a marketing automation platform with easy configuration and powerful features. It was very easy to integrate our site's forms with Customer.io

all_reviews.review_title: You can do almost everything with it
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io is a super flexible tool. I use it for transactional emails and communication. Specifically I plugged in Segment data so that I can send relevant material to everyone that sign-ups to our product. The drag and drop campaign builder is super cool and you can basically build super articulated journeys and cover all cases. I'm also using to thank new customers (Stripe webhook). Data-driven segments are just awesome to target specific cohorts and slack notification just make me feel on top of my data.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Ingestion is not always super accurate and the support is precise but still it could be a bit more helpful. I'd also like to have loops in the campaign event though I understand that it might lead to weird states

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps to automate repetitive tasks. Using behaviorual data emails are always relevant. It also helpes me to send communications to specific set of users. Every SaaS tool should have it :p

all_reviews.review_title: Great platform - lack of support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The platform is great, so much so they forgot that they need a great team. Dealing with their lack of customer support sours the experience. If you have attempted to claim the 12-month's credits there will be some excuse as to why you will not be receiving them.

You will constantly be pushed around to talk to many reps and just end up with one that responds every 48 hours - with a very passive-aggressive tone.

Honestly, a big disappointment because I personally was a big advocate of the platform and have gotten 3 companies set up on customers.io I can confidently say I would not recommend anyone use this platform, unless you are ok with figuring things out on your own.

3/10

Lack of support from the so-called customer success reps.  The fact they insist on being an email-only communication platform.

email marketing.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent service with boundless features and prompt support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io makes creating emails, whether they are broadcasts or complex campaigns, incredibly easy. It is extremely feature rich and there is nothing I want to do that I can't. As long as you have good backend data, the segmentation feature is powerful and makes complex workflows a breeeze.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
This is an extremely minor complaint, but when I am generating content using HTML, I would love a pop-out that enlarges the coding and preview space. There is a lot going on when you are looking at the "content" portion of a broadcast or campaign, and removing some of the noise and enlarging the view would be a real plus.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
It is absolutely worth it. Customer.io has transformed our email marketing, and we will never go back.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io has completely solved all email issues for my company. We can send beautiful, compelling emails to everyone, certain groups, only people who perform specific actions or really any other combination of traits. It makes it easy to focus on the right customers at the right time. The ability to A/B test in-platform is a game-changer and guarantees better results.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Customer.io?
review_question_answers.answer: Customer.io makes creating emails, whether they are broadcasts or complex campaigns, incredibly easy. It is extremely feature rich and there is nothing I want to do that I can't. As long as you have good backend data, the segmentation feature is powerful and makes complex workflows a breeeze.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Customer.io?
review_question_answers.answer: This is an extremely minor complaint, but when I am generating content using HTML, I would love a pop-out that enlarges the coding and preview space. There is a lot going on when you are looking at the "content" portion of a broadcast or campaign, and removing some of the noise and enlarging the view would be a real plus.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
review_question_answers.answer: It is absolutely worth it. Customer.io has transformed our email marketing, and we will never go back.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Customer.io has completely solved all email issues for my company. We can send beautiful, compelling emails to everyone, certain groups, only people who perform specific actions or really any other combination of traits. It makes it easy to focus on the right customers at the right time. The ability to A/B test in-platform is a game-changer and guarantees better results.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic customer support and product
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The support from Customer.io is phenomenal. They are very responsive and detailed in their recommendations and solutions. Our account manager has gone above and beyond to troubleshoot and piece together custom solutions for us. They listen to their customers' needs and actively build out new features to meet our needs.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
A lot of development needed for the initial setup to integrate with our product in order to have tailored transactional emails and personalized marketing emails. They've built out more native integrations with forms and popup tools which have been fantastic. Overall, less development required would be helpful for marketing teams.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
Whether you're an established company or a fast growing startup, Customer.io will scale with you. If you have a unique use case, Customer.io will listen and present multiple options to achieve it. The campaign workflow is robust and easy to use. With some development work, there are infinite possibilities for how you can segment and personalize your messages.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Moving our transactional emails into Customer.io has given us great analytics and helped our support team clearly see a record of email activity for users to help with troubleshooting. We've also been able to personalize our marketing emails with populating item recommendations at scale.

all_reviews.review_title: A Modern Broadcast and Campaign Email Service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Everything is so fast. The menus, the drag and drop, the duplication, and all the components you need to click.

The UI/UX all makes sense, and I was able to navigate it intuitively from day 1. It feels like a platform that was created with the full scope of its services already in mind when it was created. Other platforms I have used in the past have felt very modular.

Has handled our 20 million emails per month volume with no delays or issues. Our account rep has been very helpful and responsive.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
This isn't a dislike because we signed up knowing it was a future addition, and I know they are working on it - but React Native support for their app notifications is the one thing I wish I had now! It's in Alpha stages right now, and I know they have been working on it!

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are sending broadcast and automated campaigns to ~1.5 million contacts, and we have pretty extensive segmentation through events and attributes. Customer.io allowed us to expand the execution of these campaigns to our marketing team with minimal developer support required post-implementation.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The ease of use of the API and the thorough documentation makes the life of developers easy, on the other hand, the WYSIWYG editor allows our marketing team to write their campaigns without having to prompt the engineering team to do something and they're completely independent

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The absence of I18N campaigns is a big issue at the moment, and it brings to an unpleasant duplication of messages and conditions, which our marketing team can't handle very well on their own.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using customer.io to handle the emails that are generated by the lifecycle of our orders. We do have a great amount of emails to send and they vary conditionally, so having a tool that puts those logics into a graphic environment is greatly helping both the product team and the developers

all_reviews.review_title: Technical, powerful CRM platform for marketers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I love how technical customer.io allows me and my team to be -- from creating complex customer journeys spanning multiple marketing channels, to syncing with third-party services like Snowlfake, Slack and Facebook, to standing up triggered, data-driven campaigns. There isn't a lot my team and I haven't been able to accomplish with customer.io -- if you can dream it up, you can probably accomplish it within the platform. I love that customer.io is a tool that both marketers and engineers can use, no matter their level of expertise within the marketing or technical side of things.s

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Customer.io is definitely geared toward technical marketers, which made it a little intimidating at first, as I had never used the tool. My team and I have since become very comfortable with the platform, from standing up new event-driven triggered campaigns to deep-diving into the event and engagement history of specific customers to try to understand their communications experiences, and beyond. There's not a lot I dislike about customer.io.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
If your team is either a technical marketing team or a product or engineering team, customer.io will likely be a great fit. If your team is not at all technical, be prepared to spend a little bit of time getting up to speed and comfortable with the platform.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io allows me and my team to launch and optimize data-driven campaigns. Through customer.io, my team has built complex customer journeys based on dozens of different customer attributes, segments, events and more.

all_reviews.review_title: User Friendly Email Automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I like how easy it is to navigate. The paritions of brands makes sense for our business. Dashboard reporting is clear.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I wish there was a way to retire a/b tests and stand up new tests without losing reporting, can there be an archive feature that preseves metrics? This would also clear up the bulk that we are experiencing in the metrics of A/B testing and per campaign read outs as the old inactive tests are still reflected in the reporting modals. Not having visibility into our mix of email clients is difficult without an additional tool as we pass through our emails from MailGun to Customer.io. We'd like to understand what clients and modes to focus our design and deliverability efforts for. I'd like to be able to select more than 4 metrics at once. I would also like an undo button on the workflow in case I delete an email or function.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can build out automations easily and run A/B tests easily.

all_reviews.review_title: Good email capabilities, hoping for more features soon
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io has some great emailing capabilities and makes it easy to manage recurring campaigns and ad hoc emails in one place. The segments are convenient and handy to use for targeting, suppression, or activity tracking.  It's easy to build emails and campaigns and is fairly flexible in terms of offerings and integrations.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I wish that some parts of Customer.io were less technical. It could be our instance, but if I want to make a change to attributes or to create a preference center I have to go through our engineering team.  It would also be great to see Customer.io expand to be a more full-fledged CRM type of system with more advanced analytics, forms, landing pages, or more automation type capabilities within the platform.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io has been helpful for our team to quickly consolidate users, user activity, and communications in one place. It has some good workarounds with being able to dynamically populate content or use Liquid to personalize messages.  It allows our team to quickly and efficiently coordinate email marketing efforts.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer.io
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Email and marketing automation software that is simple to use and understand. It's powerful due to its ability to send out webhooks.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The initial setup requires the assistance of a developer, but once that is completed, it is straightforward to use.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
I like best that we use our database as the single source of truth rather than the email platform database, which is never updated. We use real-time data from our platform (B2B SaaS) with Customer.io, which allows me as a marketer to always communicate with customer segments in the best way possible. Customer.io offers a plethora of filtering options based on features and rules, which comes in handy when creating cool workflows. Overall, I'm happy with the platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer.io is the best product marketing platform for B2C apps and websites
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I love that custom.io allows product teams to create complex campaigns without the help of developers. The tool is both easy to use and extremely powerful.amazing

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I don't love that the platform is tied to (a very old version of) Liquid templating language. I get that this is a dev dependency for them, but it would be great to have access to a wider range of JS templating languages (like JSX) or broader access to javascript in campaigns.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
Customer.io makes it so easy to get started. They're my favorite technology vendor, and I can't recommend them highly enough.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io allows us to send contextual communication to customers through any channel at the right moment. It helps us solve the problem of what to send, when to send it, and it allows us to easily measure the success of every communication.

all_reviews.review_content:

I love that I can create campaigns or broadcasts. I mostly use the broadcast feature which lets me test my email in a smaller sample size before sending it to my larger lists. the analytics are great and the user interface is friendly. It also saves your templates.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
When I am writing an email, I always need to insert a piece of js so that the first names of the email list are included. I always have to get out of the email I'm writing and go back and find it on a previous one. I wish some of those logic options were readily available on the same page or could be saved.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
The analytics help us to understand the language of our customer base. Being able to schedule emails is also very nice because my work schedule is crazy and I often work at late hours so this makes things much more flexible for me.

What do you like best about Customer.io?
The first thing which makes customer.io standout in my experience,  from other substitute marketing  automation program is its ease of use.
Asides from the above, I love the level of integration which this program has got with third party analytics , automation and billing systems we use at work such as accounting suite, Clearbit, and leadsbridge. This has made it easy for us at the marketing department to regularly analyze and update user attributes, and run effective marketing experiments.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Campaign.io has been helpful to my organization to create a coordinated  digital marketing  workflow which combines short message services, push notifications and market-content driven emails together, for an  efficient customer targeting experience.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for startups to get in and set up quick and efficient engagement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I like that this tool is easy to use compared to some other contact automation tools, pricing that is both reasonable and rational, and it is easy to use and set up.

The visual tool for creating campaigns and contacts is intuitive and easy to learn. We trained an entry-level team member on the platform and they quickly adopted the tool and has since taken over all of our campaigns.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
When you set up campaigns, if you deprecate them the data and metrics for that campaign are lost or are not easily accessible. We've ended up just pausing campaigns to retain that insight - but we've some things from two years ago that are paused. It would be great to archive that data.

It would also be great to have better reporting, in general, to help report metrics and insights to those who do not use the platform directly.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
If you are an early-stage company that hasn't started anything yet, def check them out as their pricing is perfect for startups.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed to onboard a quick solution that was priced reasonably for startups to engage with our customers and leads. We've increased both engagement/retention and acquisition through engagement campaigns.

I always recommend this tool for early-stage companies - and really more mature companies - who are looking to set up their initial engagement campaigns. Customer.io is better than most of the larger, and more expensive tools, and setting up something is better than having nothing. This was emblematic with my current company as we instantly saw a reduction in churn and inactivity on our platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Advance Marketing Email Automation with Customer.io
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io is a solid tool for marketing automation. It can easily take the marketing game of a company to the next level. We in our company use Customer.io to manage all our communication with the customer primarily with email and push notifications. Managing users, events and attributes is very easy with customer.io, it is very easy to add attribute or remove them based on their event. Creating workflows for campaigns is very easy. Creating Behavioral campaigns based on attributes, events and sending email based on customer interaction can be easily configured. The workflow of customer.io is easy to configure and very powerful tool for automation. Customer.io has many email templates which is very helpful and it's very easy to add sender's and even change whole email designs. Delivery system of emails are pretty fast and reliable. Overall for automatic email customer.io is very good.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Customer.io doesn't have any option to export data. In general data collection is very weak.A/B testing could be better, It should also provide which part of the whole email is being clicked on very frequently by the user. Reporting of email lacks deeper analytics. Total analysis of emails which are being sent is not present.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io is definitely solves the problem of email automation. Our company relys on market research and with customer.io's very good email automation system it is possible for us to send the right email to the right person at the right time.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic for the advanced user!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Lightweight, fast, highly customizable, with all sorts of logic ready to go. This is absolutely a ESP for advanced users, requiring developer time and a coherent plan before starting out. If you're new to email or workflow automation, or don't have devs on staff, or don't like making HTML emails, this isn't the right choice. However, if you're a tech company, this blows the alternatives out of the water.

The campaign builder allows for a ton of configurations suitable to user on-boarding and product management, including easy Slack notifications, true/false branches for failed actions, and the best inbox deliverability I've seen (including from Hubspot and Mailchimp).

Segments are created based on rules, and make it easy to send campaigns or broadcast messages. Complex logic rules help make sure the right message goes to the right person. Detailed logs of everything make sure you're aware of what's going on.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The learning curve is steep, even for someone with experience. I'm still not sure how to neatly add multiple dynamic fields within the same layout. Transactional is currently lacking, but coming soon through their API.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Better insights into customers, lightning fast to make changes, clear UI with everything easy to find.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer Journey - The Email Way
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The ease of creating cohorts (segments) and workflow to build logic. The interface for building campaigns, workflow and the trigger definition and usage are pretty simple and usable for any novice user too without any training. The setup, especially for SSL domains may be a bit tricky and that's where the support kicks in doing a fantabulous job - quick and to the point answers, guidelines and help.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The drag-and-drop interface for email templates is confusing initially especially when you build a template later finding that a template you created from scratch can't have drag-and-drop components. In my opinion, it should allow HTML for header & footer and then allow drag-and-drop components for the content part.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
The best interface, no learning curve, minimal effort. Go for it!

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Contacting users at various touch-points in their journey through the site is usually a pain if you're doing it the code way - capturing every event and then writing specific mails building variables for customization and sort of things. Custmer.io makes that job easy by identifying the events, and helping you create logical segments. We have been able to identify the actions users take on our site and based on that, send heavily targeted emails, which has resulted in increase in all the metrices including open rate, click-through rate and above all repeat business of monetary value.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The navigation is simple and the connection to segment has vastly improved our ability to track events and actions taken by our customers. New workflows can easily be created and messages can be sent to very specific segments that are completely customizable.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The data doesn't always come in the cleanest and so there are necessary steps to take when making sure everyone that needs to be involved in a messaging campaign is accurately accounted for.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using another software for our B2B customers, but we really needed a way to separate but still engage with our B2C customers. Customer.io has helped us achieve this goal. It is able to pull in all the correct information we need and runs smoothly. The other issues we've ever had were on our side and not Customer.io.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful Marketing automation solution for our company
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io is our primary tool for automating all our email campaigns. We've configured auto-trigger that instantly sends an email when a customer performs a specific action or event on our web application. It can be easily integrated with other services such as Google Analytics, Amplitude, AWS S3, Google Ads and many more to extends its functionality. The rule-based visual workflow allows us to create logic and send the campaign only when an event occurs.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Designing email with the visual designer isn't that nice as there is a lot of problems when adding dynamic variables in the template.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Customer.io for automating our emails and enhancing the experience and journey of our customers. We can easily send all the events and activities of our users through javascript API to customer.io and send emails or campaigns based on customer action. Training and educating users with customer.io is really easy and its really easy to implement as its API is available in almost every programming language.

all_reviews.review_title: A functional email system with good support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
When we build new apps or startup prototypes for clients, Customer.io is one of the most reliable tools in our stack. It makes customer communication SO easy and intuitive, allowing you to easily group customers into segments, trigger communications based on specific events, etc. The API is easy to use too, and makes it really easy to integrate with your app at a deep level. I couldn't imagine life without it!

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
With regards to building a Campaign. Before dealing with the dynamic variables in your template, you first have to make it available to you. In other words, from your code, you need to send in the payload with the variables that you wish to reference. Then, the template will come to life with your sample data and you can begin to finalise your design. I just feel that maybe, if we can have a dummy data kinda workflow for the UI of Customer.IO, that would be cool.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
There are two features I use. The newsletter builder and the Campaign builder. As a marketer, I like to send out notification emails to our customers. The API is easy to use and predictable. I didn't have to hours trying to send out an email. It was straightforward, fast and most importantly, reliable.

Customer.io is a platform that is responsible for sending emails to customers, marketing messages, among others.
This tool guarantees a direct interaction with the client, generating a degree of satisfaction and reliability to each one of them.
I like this platform that has a very powerful segmentation tool, which allows the use of relevant customer data such as events, e-mail interaction, among others. To then proceed to communicate with this.
I also like this tool that offers various integrations with very important and useful platforms. Among these are Salesforce, Gmail, Zapier, etc.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I do not like this platform that it is necessary to have knowledge of HTML to be able to optimize the designs of the emails.
I also find that the prices of this platform are quite high, the most economic plan is $ 100 per month. This really is a bit expensive compared to other similar tool prices.

It is incredible the security that transmits us to work with this platform when sending information to our clients. all_reviews.review_title: An excellent creator of email marketing campaigns, with a good automation system.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io has 2 characteristics that are glorious and mark a small but valuable difference with respect to the competition.

The first is that this platform has a tool that uses javascript and allows you to obtain information from your users on other sites. In this way you can learn more about your users' internet activity and thus use that information to enhance your marketing strategy.

The second is the fact of being able to track the status of your emails and thus keep track of the ones you have already sent. It may seem a bit stupid tool but for someone who knows how to use it, it is known if your email has already been read or can not provide valuable information that can be used in the marketing strategy.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
These are the points that should generate attention to the customer.io team:

The templates are not very attractive. I think they should expand the catalog of templates and offer other models that fit other needs since it is difficult to adjust the current templates to the needs of our company. In the end this ends up affecting the productivity of the advertising campaign.

Technical support is not the most efficient in the world. They take a while to respond and sometimes they do not solve your doubt.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
If you are new to this world and you need to automate advertising emails customer.io is a good option. It complies with what it offers and a couple of other things. However, I also recommend researching their functions and prices to ensure that you are taking the best option.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
The automation of advertising via email is a great tool to save time and increase the productivity of your company. With customer.io this theme is solved in a great way and also includes a couple of unexpected tools that provide more valuable information for the campaign. Our company thanks you.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy and effective marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
It is a fast and efficient system, it gives us an automated way to launch our email marketing campaigns.
The segmentation engine is the key feature of the software, it facilitates the process of sending newsletters and communications to groups of users, based on their preferences and the degree of interaction with our products and services.
Moreover, Customer.io also allows us to export data in CSV, which facilitates the migration of customer databases to software platform.It also allows you to launch A / B testing easily.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Meets our expectations, it gives us the solution to monitor our digital marketing campaigns. However, monthly subscriptions for small businesses are expensive.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
It meets the needs of businesses that need a digital solution to innovate and automate email marketing campaigns.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reports are key to identify trends, which is very useful to improve communication with customers, and to significantly increase the rate of conversions since we conduct campaigns based on user behavior. It is also an effective tool to measure the customer experience.

all_reviews.review_title: Slick interface
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I'm a fairly new user of Customer.io, but as a long time "enterprise-level" marketing automation user, I've found this tool to have a good number of the features I used in other tools. The interface is SO easy to use, very intuitive, and reporting on broadcast email performance is so simple.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Nothing at this point - I still have a lot to dig into. I wonder if they will start to incorporate some features that traditional marketing automation tools have (forms, nurture/drip functionality, scoring, etc.)

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Right now, just using it to get communications out to customers, specifically around new product features. Will begin to incorporate content communications to prospects in the short-term.

all_reviews.review_title: E-mails made easy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
This platform is WAY easy to navigate compared to what we were using beforehand. The UI is straightforward and creating a campaign with little time that looks sleek is not longer a task I don't look forward to. Their customer service is incredible, along with all of the resources available through their site to answer any questions you might have about information location or functionality.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The templates leave more to be desired than those from competitors, but the ease of creating and sending out these e-mails makes up for the limitation. You can always design your own email template and input the source code.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Customer.io about once a week to send out emails to our followers, and we are able to see which campaigns yield the best traffic results and sales. It's helped us tremendously with honing in and targeting our specific demographics while giving our company a professional look.

all_reviews.review_title: Customer.io--Powerful and Personal
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Customer.io has two great things going for it. First, the platform is incredibly flexible. If you dream up an email campaign, there's a way to make it happen with Customer.io. Second, their customer support team is beyond compare. They provide rapid, personalized assistance and take your inputs to heart. I smile every time I see a new feature roll out that solves I problem I previously brought up with the support team.



What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I mainly create campaigns and don't deal as much with logging user data to Customer.io, so I have to turn to my own development team to get new information logged, which can take some time. Writing campaign triggers based on Liquid code also involves a bit of a learning curve.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io lets me automate all of our student-facing messaging, letting us provide accurate and timely information to our student body without the hassle of combing through endless streams of student data. With Customer.io, we're able to keep more students on track with their curriculum and improve student success. And whenever we need to add a new campaign or tweak an old one, Customer.io has the tools to make that possible.

The customer support team was incredible, always offering quick advice and even custom engineering support.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Uploading custom email segments was not as easy as we would have liked and often resulted in emails to customer support. In reality, 80% of the emails we service are transaction and can be support with the pixel, but most systems can't support the super custom logic we use to power some lists.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
Make sure you have clear use cases in mind and are biasing towards transactional email

Customer I/O was being used as both our transactional and email promotions platform. The integration was incredibly easy, as was onboarding. We were up and running within days of signing the deal.

all_reviews.review_title: Very Powerful, but not always Intuitive
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I like that you can pass custom data from your own product or users into Customer.io for use in segmenting users and in the copy of the emails you're sending. Even cooler is the ability to automatically trigger these campaigns based on a user's entrance into a segment or a specific action they take in the product. That's extremely powerful for our enterprise product.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The UI makes it somewhat challenging to navigate from start to finish through creating a campaign, the template editor has some big limitations, and there's no easy way of managing a larger number of campaigns (either with better previews or with grouping that's more specific than just "Triggered")

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
The competition set for this product really varies depending on your needs. I think customer.io is really powerful when compared with something like mailchimp or just sending gmail. But, I do think there are some strong contenders in the multi-channel automation outreach space that give customer.io a run for its money (Autopilot comes to mind).

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io helps us send automated platform emails without having as much technical maintenance of our own. It also helps us scale our product-centric marketing efforts. I think we can actually realize even further benefits from the product, and we're working on review those opportunities as we speak!

all_reviews.review_title: Email - done right.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
The seamless integration between Customer.io and Segment has allowed our company to send emails intuitively based on specific triggers, filters, and logic. They also provide the tools we require for internal communication within Slack, SMS, Trello and more!

With Customer.io emails are the product of logic, not assumption. What more can you want?

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
Would be very nice to include a built-in email template builder. A WYSIWIG editor alone could suffice. As of now I am having to have these templates coded and then input into the source code section.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io is re-defining the value of our emails. When you're a consumer and are identifying with a brand, it's important you aren't bombarded with emails at random, based on assumptions of the users journey. We also use Customer.io for internal notifications via Slack, SMS etc..

With Customer.io, I am able to sync real-time user data and setup email logic which is then used to communicate with users optimally.  In understanding this, Customer.io has empowered us to setup campaigns for several key points in the user journey (e.g. onboarding, upselling, crosselling).

all_reviews.review_title: Hard to Setup, Easy to Use Later
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
- Lightweight and powerful UI
- Very fast
- Good price
- Email Layouts easy to configure
- Easy to define goals, workflows, triggers...it's so "smart"

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
- Very hard to configure unless you are very technical. Not tracking anonymous users suck (we had to build a workaround on that)
- Stats could be improved, you won't get too far apart from standalone reports
- Exports are a bit poor
- Not that many integrations

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
Get ready to suffer on the setup. Is hard. If you want to track anonymous users, it's very complex and not elegant.
But beneath that, it's very powerful. For us, workflows have infinite ROI (well, not that much, but A LOT).

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it to send behavioral emails (abandonment carts, welcome emails) and newsletter emails.
It's very easy to use, the cost per email and user is cheap, the interface is smart, fast and lightweight.
It is versatile, you have many options to segment. It's mainly an empty container with infinite options. It may seem overwhelming but for marketers it's the holy grail.

all_reviews.review_title: An Effective Email Marketing Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
What I like best about Customer. io is the possibility of personalization. There are many ways to personalize this email marketing tool. Segmentation is one of them: If you integrate Customer with your CRM or/ and other platforms it gets even more interesting. Let's say you have several campaigns for different products and specific audiences established in your CRM. By integrating Customer with your CRM you can send personalized campaigns to each audience and even pick which ones to track and how (converted rate, clicks, etc).

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
The biggest disadvantage that Customer. io has Vs. other email marketing tools is the fact that their templates are not especially attractive. The templates are just functional. They don't offer beautiful graphic options, not even the fonts have many possibilities. Which is in a way a limitation for marketing campaigns, but probably not a big problem for follow up emails.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Customer. io at least twice a week. We communicate with our customers in an effective way. We also review which campaigns, newsletters, etc. are working better. The options we have regarding the segmentation is key for us.

all_reviews.review_title: Poorly Designed, Unwieldy Email Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
Not much. It does have the functionality to set up email campaigns, including drip campaigns. And it does have a basic email editor, allowing you to play with the layout of your email. But beyond having the 'basics,' it is not user-friendly and overall not well-organized.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
First, it isn't user-friendly. The UI is not intuitive, so it takes longer to find what you're looking for and accomplish what you're trying to do (compared to other email platforms I've used, such as MailChimp and Constant Contact). Secondly, the organization of 'environments' makes it difficult to manage one master list of email subscribers. Customer.io doesn't allow different 'environments' to interact with each other, nor share any data -- which can make it difficult to navigate subscriber lists, difficult to assess for duplicate subscribers, and difficult to report on email campaigns and analyze comparisons. The basic email editor is not user-friendly, and often slow to load. This platform does give you the ability to edit the HTML of an email directly, and I ended up directly editing the HTML nearly all of the time, in order to avoid using the clunky and confusing editor they provide. It seems like this platform can do the basic email functions a marketer would ask of it, but the organization, layout, and overall UI of the platform make it so cumbersome to use that it's far more frustrating to the user than helpful.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Benefits include being able to send emails, being able to see stats after email campaigns are sent. The benefits don't outweigh the flaws in the platform.

There isn't anything that I particularly dislike about the product, however, we have been using it for less than a year.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
If you currently don't track email activity, I recommend using Customer.io to start. I like the templates that you can build into Customer.io which make it easy to send out regular communication to specific audiences from various departments.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer.io allows us to easily distribute mass communications to specific segments of our audiences and track their activity.

all_reviews.review_title: Love it!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I love the Ruby API! https://customer.io/docs/api/ruby.html We have some custom events that are not available from the JS snippet, so being able to add our own events through the API has allowed us to set up some awesome drip campaigns through Customer.io.

Special mention for their adorable mascot.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
I haven't run into anything that I didn't like so far!

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
Use the segment integration! It makes getting your users into the system take like 20 seconds and once you have Segment set up in your system, any new integrations (like Customerio) don't need to change your codebase.

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are running multi-touch campaigns as part of a customer advocacy program and their 'Triggered' campaigns work incredibly well for this. Their segments + a campaign makes this really easy.

all_reviews.review_title: Brilliant way to lighten the load for developers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Customer.io?
I love the fact that, as an engineer, I'm not constantly having to build specific product for our growth team, sales teams, customer service team, etc etc.

What do you dislike about Customer.io?
There's not much that I dislike. I guess if I had to come up with something, it would be the steep cost. Well worth it, but the cheapest tier is currently $100.

Recommendations to others considering Customer.io:
Send your data to segment and have that forward along to customer.io

What problems is Customer.io solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it to segment different email campaigns, notify members of bookings, receipts, pretty much any action based email trigger. It's been a time saver and engineering resource saver.

Shared objects like Newsletters, Segments, etc between 'Multi-Environments' is problem some.
Refresh in interface is a bit slow.
Filtering is poor.
Search (ed) fields is limited to just email address of user.
No branching logic in campaigns.
No Relational Data model.
No Triggering on atribute changes without a 'custom event'. (i.e. was that is now this)
